intro: Dactyladenia librevillensis, commonly known as the Libreville dactyladenia, is a climbing plant native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, and it is often found in humid, tropical environments. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphological features and its role in local ecosystems.
